name: Get2College
description: Get2College is a non-profit organization that provides college planning services, including ACT prep, professional development, and financial aid assistance to Mississippi families and teachers. They offer classroom and virtual presentations, financial aid nights for parents, and FAFSA completion assistance
services: African-American-owned College planning in Mississippi consultation

name: Mississippi Office of State Financial Aid
description: This office administers state aid programs, including grants and scholarships for Mississippi students. They provide information on various state aid programs like HELP, MTAG, MESG, FAITH, LAW, and the Nissan Scholarship
services: African-American-owned College planning in Mississippi consultation

name: Jackson State University (JSU)
address: 1400 John R. Lynch Street, Jackson, MS 39217
description: As a public historically Black research university, JSU offers a wide range of academic programs and support services. Their College of Business and other departments can provide guidance and resources related to career and financial planning for students
services: African-American-owned College planning in Mississippi consultation

name: University of Mississippi (Ole Miss)
description: Mississippi's flagship university, Ole Miss, offers various scholarships and financial aid opportunities for incoming students. Their admissions and financial aid offices can provide detailed information
services: African-American-owned College planning in Mississippi consultation

name: Mississippi State University
address: 1 Science and Technology Rd, Starkville, MS 39759
description: Mississippi State University provides information on scholarships and financial aid for both resident and non-resident students, including automatic consideration scholarships based on academic merit
services: African-American-owned College planning in Mississippi consultation

name: Alcorn State University
description: As the first Black land-grant institution in the U.S., Alcorn State University offers various programs and support services that can assist students with their college planning and financial aid needs
services: African-American-owned College planning in Mississippi consultation

name: Tougaloo College
address: 500 W. County Line Road, Tougaloo, MS 39174
description: Tougaloo College, a historically Black college, provides a range of academic programs and student support services that contribute to college readiness and planning
services: African-American-owned College planning in Mississippi consultation

name: Rust College
description: This historically Black liberal arts college offers a personalized educational experience and can assist students with navigating the college application and financial aid processes
services: African-American-owned College planning in Mississippi consultation

name: Mississippi Valley State University
description: MVSU is another HBCU in Mississippi that provides educational programs and resources to support students in their pursuit of higher education
services: African-American-owned College planning in Mississippi consultation

name: Noyes Academic Consulting LLC
description: While not exclusively African-American-owned or Mississippi-based, Noyes Academic Consulting offers services that include college scholarship application assistance, FAFSA completion, and financial aid guidance. Their website provides information on their services and packages
services: African-American-owned College planning in Mississippi consultation
